Description: Brown hematite cylinder seal; a robed king with one hand raised and a kilted figure in royal posture face a robed figure with one hand raised; all the figures wear caps. In the field are a human head above a crook; a crescent moon over which has been cut a lightning fork above a monkey. Traces of a base-line beneath the figures. The inscription is less deeply cut.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (537)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
